info.title: Destination Service (Cloud Foundry)
info.description:
Destination Service (Cloud Foundry) REST API provides a way to read and manage destination configurations (including related certificates and fragments) with auto-retrieving and caching of auth tokens.

Note: For all requests, the maximum length of [a URI](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986#section-3) is 4000 characters.

externalDocs.description: Read and manage destination configurations (including related certificates and fragments).

servers.description: Read and manage destination configurations (including related certificates and fragments) on account and service instance levels with auto-retrieving and caching of auth tokens

get.summary: Find a destination by name on all levels and return the first match
get.description: Search priority is destination on service instance level. If none is found, fallbacks to subaccount level (accessible by all apps deployed in the same subaccount).

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Destination name

parameters.name: X-user-token
parameters.description: This header is only taken into account for authentication type that require user information to be provided (such as OAuth2UserTokenExchange, OAuth2JWTBearer, SAPAssertionSSO (deprecated!) and OAuth2SAMLBearerAssertion). If provided, the value must be a user JWT token in encoded form (see https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7519). If provided, it will be used with priority over the Authorization header for the token exchange operation. This means that the user token from this header will be used when determining the user and the tenant subdomain and will also be the token, for which token exchange is performed. If this header is not provided, the user token from the Authorization header will be used. If both this header and X-tenant are provided, the request will fail with HTTP 400 Bad Request.

parameters.name: X-refresh-token
parameters.description: This header is only taken into account for a destination with authentication type OAuth2RefreshToken. This is an additional mandatory parameter that must be provided in the request header. The value must be provided in a refresh token format according to (see https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-6) When provided, the refresh token will be used fetch a new refresh and new access token from the configured OAuth2 tokenServiceURL.

parameters.name: X-code
parameters.description: This header is only taken into account for a destination with authentication type OAuth2AuthorizationCode. This is a mandatory parameter that must be provided in the request header. The value must be provided in an authorization code format according to (see https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6749.html#section-4.1.3) When provided, the authorization code will be exchanged for an access token from the configured OAuth2 tokenServiceURL.

parameters.name: X-redirect-uri
parameters.description: This header is only taken into account for a destination with authentication type OAuth2AuthorizationCode. This is an optional parameter, that can be provided in the request header. The value must be provided in a URL-encoded link according to (see https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6749.html#section-4.1.3). When a redirect URI was registered in the the configured OAuth2 token service during the authorization code grant, the token service will require the same redirect URI to be provided for that authorization code. If provided, the token service will check if the registered redirect URI matches the requested one. If they do, the authorization code is exchanged for an access token. If not provided in the case of a registered redirect URI, the access token exchange will fail.

parameters.name: X-code-verifier
parameters.description: This header is only taken into account for a destination with authentication type OAuth2AuthorizationCode. This is an optional parameter, that can be provided in the request header. The value must be provided in a code verifier format according to (see https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7636#page-8). When an application has generated a code verifier and provided a code challenge derived from it in the authorization code grant, it must send the code verifier for the token exchange. If provided, the configured OAuth2 token service will verify the code challenge and verifier. If they match, the authorization code will be exchanged for an access token. If not provided in the case of a given code challenge in the authorization code grant, the access token exchange will fail.

parameters.name: X-tenant
parameters.description: This header is only taken into account for destinations with auth type set to OAuth2ClientCredentials. It represents the subdomain of the tenant, on behalf of which to fetch an access token, using the configured credentials. The header is required when tokenServiceURLType is Common and the value will be used to replace the tenant placeholder (or will be added as a subdomain if no placeholder is present). If not provided, an error will be returned. If tokenServiceURLType is Dedicated, the use of this header is forbidden and an error will be returned if provided in the request. If both this header and X-user-token are provided, the request will fail with HTTP 400 Bad Request.

parameters.name: X-client-assertion
parameters.description: This header is used when OAuth2 Client Assertion Authentication is used. It can be used in pair with the 'X-client-assertion-type' header, specifying the assertion type. The value is the assertion that is used to authenticate the client. When using the Client Assertion mechanism, the client secret property in the destination should be empty. Usage of header 'X-client-assertion-destination-name' is not allowed if this header is present.

parameters.name: X-client-assertion-type
parameters.description: This header provides client assertion type in OAuth2 Client Assertion Authentication flow. It can be used in pair with the 'X-client-assertion' header. The value is the format of the Client assertion as defined by the authorization server. For example, when we use JWT token as assertion the value should be 'urn:ietf:params:oauth:client-assertion-type:jwt-bearer'. Usage of header 'X-client-assertion-destination-name' is not allowed if this header is present.

parameters.name: X-client-assertion-destination-name
parameters.description: This header can be added in order to use client assertion mechanism for the OAuth flows. The value is the name of a destination that makes a client assertion token retrieval. This header can also override the property 'clientAssertion.destinationName' of the destination that is a target of this call. Usage of headers 'X-client-assertion' and 'X-client-assertion-type' is not allowed if this header is present.

parameters.name: X-fragment-name
parameters.description: The name of the destination fragment used to override and/or extend the requested destination properties. In case of overlapping properties, the values of the fragment properties take priority over the values of the destination properties. The destination fragment must be maintained and available on the same level as the destination. Only one fragment shall be sent as part of the request.

parameters.name: $skipCredentials
parameters.description: Credentials are skipped in the returned destination configuration. This parameter is useful especially for OAuth destinations (such as OAuth2UserTokenExchange, OAuth2JWTBearer, OAuth2SAMLBearerAssertion). The client application actually needs the auto-retrieved token by the service, which makes the credentials optional for the application, and in certain cases it is preferred not be returned in the response.

parameters.name: $skipTokenRetrieval
parameters.description: If set to true, the service will skip the retrieval of the authentication token and the response will contain only the requested destination configuration. If the destination configuration is set to use mTLS for token retrieval and $skipTokenRetrieval=true, the response will also contain the content of the token service keystore.

parameters.name: If-None-Match
parameters.description: This header allows performing an HTTP ETag (entity tag) comparison. If provided, it would let the server determine how the request shall be processed. In case the actual server-side ETag value is different from the value passed in this header, the server responds sending the current server-state of the requested resource. Otherwise, the server responds with a status code HTTP 304 (Not Modified) and empty response body. If this header is not provided, the server responds with the current server-state of the requested resource.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: This header allows performing an HTTP ETag (entity tag) comparison. If provided, it would let the server determine how the request shall be processed. In case the actual server-side ETag value matches the value passed in this header, the server responds sending the current server-state of the requested resource. Otherwise, the server responds with a status code HTTP 412 (Precondition Failed). If this header is not provided, the server responds with the current server-state of the requested resource.

200.description: JSON object which contains the owner (the level), found destination, certificates (if present) and authorization token (if present).

ETag.description: Current server-side ETag value of the resource.

304.description: Not Modified. Indicates that the current server-side resource version is the same as one of the versions the client passed as part of the value of If-None-Match request header.

ETag.description: Current server-side ETag value of the resource.

400.description: Bad Request. Indicates that there is something missing / malformed / incorrect about the request. The response body holds more information about the exact issue

404.description: The requested resource could not be found

412.description: Precondition Failed. Indicates that the current server-side resource version is not the same as one of the versions the client passed as part of the value of If-Match request header.

ETag.description: Current server-side ETag value of the resource.

get.summary: Get all destinations posted on subaccount level
get.description:
Get a list of destinations (as a JSON array) posted on subaccount
level. If none is found, an empty array is returned. Subaccount is determined
by the passed OAuth access token.

For requests which return a large number of destinations, chunked handling of the response will be enabled. If an error occurs with the request processing while chunking is enabled, no response will be returned to the client.

Note: The maximum length of the `<path>?<query>#<fragment>` part of [a URI](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986#section-3) is 4000 characters.

Link.description: This header returns information for the next and/or previous link page. It should look like: ```</subaccountDestinations?$page=1&$pageSize=10>; rel='previous', </subaccountDestinations?$page=3&$pageSize=10>; rel='next' ```

400.description: Bad Request

404.description: The requested resource could not be found

put.summary: Update a destination or destinations posted on subaccount level
put.description: Update (overwrite) an existing destination or destinations with a new destination (as a JSON object) or with new destinations (as a JSON array), posted on subaccount level. Subaccount is determined by the passed OAuth access token.

requestBody.description: Destination properties (as a JSON object) / Destinations properties (as a JSON array)

207.description: Multi-Status code. Indicates successfully and unsuccessfully updated destinations.

400.description: Bad Request. Missing request body etc.

404.description: The requested resource could not be found

get.summary: Get all certificates posted on subaccount level
get.description:
Get all certificates (as a JSON array) posted on subaccount level.
In none is found, an empty array is returned. Subaccount is determined by
the passed OAuth access token.

For requests which return a large number of certificates, chunked handling of the response will be enabled. If an error occurs with the request processing while chunking is enabled, no response will be returned to the client.

Note: The maximum length of the `<path>?<query>#<fragment>` part of [a URI](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986#section-3) is 4000 characters.

200.description: JSON array which contains the base64 encoded contents of the certificates

Link.description: This header returns information for the next and/or previous link page. It should look like: ```</subaccountCertificates?$page=1&$pageSize=10>; rel='previous', </subaccountCertificates?$page=3&$pageSize=10>; rel='next' ```

400.description: Bad Request

404.description: The requested resource could not be found

put.summary: Update a certificate or certificates on subaccount level
put.description: Update a certificate (base64 encoded string, as a JSON object) or certificates (base64 encoded string, as a JSON array) or certificate attributes (certificate is generated by destination service) or certificate attributes with CSR (certificate is generated by destination service via externally provided CSR. The subject DN in the CSR is ignored. Only PEM certificate can be generated.) on subaccount level. Subaccount is determined by the passed OAuth access token.

requestBody.description: The certificate (base64 encoded string, as a JSON object) / Certificates (base64 encoded string, as a JSON array) / Certificate attributes / Certificate attributes with CSR (base64 encoded PEM)

207.description: Multi-Status code. Indicates successfully and unsuccessfully put certificates.

400.description: Bad Request. Missing request body etc.

404.description: The requested resource could not be found

parameters.description: This header allows performing an HTTP ETag (entity tag) comparison. If provided, it would let the server determine how the request shall be processed. In case the actual server-side ETag value is different from the value passed in this header, the server responds sending the current server-state of the requested resource. Otherwise, the server responds with a status code HTTP 304 (Not Modified) and empty response body. If this header is not provided, the server responds with the current server-state of the requested resource.

In case the actual server-side ETag value matches the value passed in this header, the server responds sending the current server-state of the requested resource. Otherwise, the server responds with a status code HTTP 412 (Precondition Failed). If this header is not provided, the server responds with the current server-state of the requested resource.

destinations_getAll_filter.name: $filter
destinations_getAll_filter.description:
A filter expression, which specifies what destinations to return. It could either be an in-list condition or a starts-with condition.

Allowed only in the default mode. As such, **$filter** cannot be combined with **$select**, nor **$page**.

## In-list condition

Syntax: `$filter=Name in (<list_of_names>)`

Retrieves all destinations with the specified names from the list.
Every name in the list of names should be [percent-encoded](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3986#section-2.1) and after that surrounded by single quotes.

For example, let's look at two destinations with names "our team's app" and "workflow (new)".

The query parameter for them would be constructed as follows:

```
$filter=Name in ('our%20team%27s%20app', 'workflow%20%28new%29')
```

You can pass this value to curl's **--data-urlencode** option and the resulting URI for the HTTP request would end like this:

```
/destination-configuration/v1/subaccountDestinations?$filter=Name+in+%28%27our%2520team%2527s%2520app%27%2c+%27workflow%2520%2528new%2529%27%29
```

Note: `Name` is the only supported field.

## Starts-with condition

Syntax: `$filter=startswith(Name, 'prefix')`

Retrieves all destinations whose names start with the specified prefix. Any single quote inside the prefix needs to be escaped by replacing it with two consecutive single quotes. All other characters must not be escaped.

For example, for a destination with name "(new) our team's app", a starts-with filter could be:

```
$filter=startswith(Name, '(new) our team''s app')
```

Note: `Name` is the only supported field.

certificates_getAll_filter.name: $filter
certificates_getAll_filter.description:
A filter expression, which specifies what certificates to return. It can only be an in-list condition.

Allowed only in the default mode. As such, **$filter** cannot be combined with **$select**, nor **$page**.

## In-list condition

Syntax: `$filter=Name in (<list_of_names>)`

Retrieves all certificates with the specified names from the list.
Every name in the list of names should be [percent-encoded](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3986#section-2.1) and after that surrounded by single quotes.

For example, let's look at two certificates with names "our team's app.pem" and "workflow (new).pem".

The query parameter for them would be constructed as follows:

```
$filter=Name in ('our%20team%27s%20app.pem', 'workflow%20%28new%29.pem')
```

You can pass this value to curl's **--data-urlencode** option and the resulting URI for the HTTP request would end like this:

```
/destination-configuration/v1/subaccountCertificates?$filter=Name+in+%28%27our%2520team%2527s%2520app.pem%27%2c+%27workflow%2520%2528new%2529.pem%27%29
```

Note: `Name` is the only supported field.

destinations_bulkDelete_filter.name: $filter
destinations_bulkDelete_filter.description:
A filter expression, which specifies what destinations to delete. It can only be an in-list condition.

## In-list condition

Syntax: `$filter=Name in (<list_of_names>)`

Deletes all destinations with the specified names from the list.
Every name in the list of names should be [percent-encoded](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3986#section-2.1) and after that surrounded by single quotes.

For example, let's look at two destinations with names "our team's app" and "workflow (new)".

The query parameter for them would be constructed as follows:

```
$filter=Name in ('our%20team%27s%20app', 'workflow%20%28new%29')
```

You can pass this value to curl's **--data-urlencode** option and the resulting URI for the HTTP request would end like this:

```
/destination-configuration/v1/subaccountDestinations?$filter=Name+in+%28%27our%2520team%2527s%2520app%27%2c+%27workflow%2520%2528new%2529%27%29
```

Note: `Name` is the only supported field.

certificates_bulkDelete_filter.name: $filter
certificates_bulkDelete_filter.description:
A filter expression, which specifies what certificates to delete. It can only be an in-list condition.

## In-list condition

Syntax: `$filter=Name in (<list_of_names>)`

Deletes all certificates with the specified names from the list.
Every name in the list of names should be [percent-encoded](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3986#section-2.1) and after that surrounded by single quotes.

For example, let's look at two certificates with names "our team's app.pem" and "workflow (new).pem".

The query parameter for them would be constructed as follows:

```
$filter=Name in ('our%20team%27s%20app.pem', 'workflow%20%28new%29.pem')
```

You can pass this value to curl's **--data-urlencode** option and the resulting URI for the HTTP request would end like this:

```
/destination-configuration/v1/subaccountCertificates?$filter=Name+in+%28%27our%2520team%2527s%2520app.pem%27%2c+%27workflow%2520%2528new%2529.pem%27%29
```

Note: `Name` is the only supported field.

destinations_select.name: $select
destinations_select.description:
Enable select mode, in order to retrieve only destination names. 

In select mode the response changes from a list of destinations to a list of their names. Only the `Name` field is supported as a value.

Note: Only one mode is allowed for a request. As such, **$select** cannot be combined with **$page**, nor **$filter**.

certificates_select.name: $select
certificates_select.description:
Enable select mode, in order to retrieve only certificate names. 

In select mode the response changes from a list of certificates to a list of their names. Only the `Name` field is supported as a value.

Note: Only one mode is allowed for a request. As such, **$select** cannot be combined with **$page**, nor **$filter**.

destinations_page.name: $page
destinations_page.description:
Enable pagination mode and retrieve the specified page number.

In pagination mode the list of destinations is partitioned into pages of size **$pageSize** and only the specified page is returned.
Page numbering starts from 1.

Note: Only one mode is allowed for a request. As such, **$page** cannot be combined with **$select**, nor **$filter**.

certificates_page.name: $page
certificates_page.description:
Enable pagination mode and retrieve the specified page number.

In pagination mode the list of certificates is partitioned into pages of size **$pageSize** and only the specified page is returned.
Page numbering starts from 1.

Note: Only one mode is allowed for a request. As such, **$page** cannot be combined with **$select**, nor **$filter**.

pageSize.name: $pageSize
pageSize.description:
Number of items in each page.

Allowed only in pagination mode (see **$page** query parameter).

pageCount.name: $pageCount
pageCount.description:
Whether to return the information about the total count of pages
for the request, via **Page-Count** response header.

Allowed only in pagination mode (see **$page** query parameter).

entityCount.name: $entityCount
entityCount.description:
Whether to return the information about the total count of entities
for the request, via **Entity-Count** response header.

Allowed only in pagination mode (see **$page** query parameter).

Type.description: Type of the object. Could be null if not present
Type of the object. Could be null if not present or PEM

Value.description: value for the validity time unit

AutomaticRenew.description: Enable automatic certificate renew when the certificate is close to expiring.

Password.description: Password which protects the generated private key (in case of pem) or keystore.

Alias.description: Alias of a certificate from the keystore. This attribute will not be present when the input is not a keystore.

Content.description: Base64 encoded certificate chain in PEM format

refresh_token.description: Base64 encoded refresh token binary content

scope.description: The scopes issued with the token. The value of the scope parameter is expressed as a list of space-delimited strings. For example "read write execute"

DestinationLookUpResult.description: Contains the owner, found destination, certificates (if present) and authorization token (if present)

Owner.description: Subaccount id and instance id could have null value but not both at the same time

value.description: The appropriate authorization scheme (token type) and token using the correct separator

HttpHeader.description: Prepared HTTP Header with appropriate authorization (token type) scheme and token

NameOnly.description: Configuration JSON object, containing only the ```Name``` field.

status.description: The status of the operation for this configuration

reason.description: This field is only present when the status is "NOT_FOUND" and represents the reason for this status

Summary.description: A list of the processed configurations and their status(DELETED, NOT_FOUND)
